channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16672] Add option for bulk load to always copy hfile(s) instead of renaming
item.description: This is related to HBASE-14417, to support incrementally restoring to multiple destinations, this issue adds option which would always copy hfile(s) during bulk load.
item.summary: Add option for bulk load to always copy hfile(s) instead of renaming

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Draft patch.
Still needs to add client side config.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Patch v4 addresses TestHRegionServerBulkLoadWithOldClient.

Hi, Ted

The stack trace looks confusing.
1. Why incremental restore was bulk loading the file paths that are in an existing table? The incremental restore should be restoring files from the backup image. The files in the backup image may be coming from the existing table originally. But the files should be physically in the backup image. This is different from the snapshot restore, where it is a in-place restore.
2. What the snapshot failed with the missing file?

An bulk load option to keep the original files (not move/rename them to target) seems a fine option. We can simplify the JIRA description to describe just that, without the confusing stack trace.

Also there is another place that needs to be taken care of, in the SecureBulkLoadListener where we move or copy the files to staging dir. In the secure bulk load case, that is the place to decide copy or rename.

I agree that there is no need to dive into the details of the aforementioned stack trace. I simplified the description accordingly.
Discussion on the stack trace can be carried out over in HBASE-14417.

w.r.t. the SecureBulkLoadListener, we have this code:


          if (bulkLoadListener != null) {

            finalPath = bulkLoadListener.prepareBulkLoad(familyName, path);

          }

          Path commitedStoreFile = store.bulkLoadHFile(finalPath, seqId, copyFile);

The new flag would be effective based on the return value from bulkLoadListener.prepareBulkLoad().
I feel there is no need to modify BulkLoadListener.

Let me know if I missed something.

If SecureBulkLoadListener is not modified, the files will be moved/renamed from the source to staging dir, then based on the flag will be copied to region store directory.
You don't want the files to be kept in the staging dir. You want them to be kept at the source.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
The copy of the backup files should be done by the restore op and then pass the copied file path to the bulk load rather than giving option for the bulk load itself to rename/copy?

SecureBulkLoadListener has logic for the copy through staging dir.

I think we should reuse this part of code.

One doubt here, pardon me I haven't went through backup design yet.
What I understand is backup of data will be stored on another cluster. On restore, the data will be transferred from backup cluster to the main cluster so there will be two different FS involved, so data will finally be copied to source cluster, it will not be renamed.
Is my understanding correct ?

Restoring to another cluster is one scenario. On the cluster where restore is performed, multiple destination tables should be supported.

Local restore (target table on the same cluster) should also be supported.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

Test failures were not related.
I ran a few with patch which passed:


Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHCM

Tests run: 24, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 1, Time elapsed: 324.538 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHCM

Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: ignoring option MaxPermSize=256m; support was removed in 8.0

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.TestMobFlushSnapshotFromClient

Tests run: 9, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 128.417 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.TestMobFlushSnapshotFromClient

With this patch if copyFile is true then we are maintaining three copies of the file. One in backup directory, second one in staging directory and third one in the region directory.
Why we want to again copy the file from staging directory to region directory, can't we just rename it here ?

The first copy is part of backup artifacts which should be immutable.
There is no third copy:


-            finalPath = bulkLoadListener.prepareBulkLoad(familyName, path);

+            finalPath = bulkLoadListener.prepareBulkLoad(familyName, path, copyFile);

+            copyFile = false;

Once hfile is copied to staging dir, there wouldn't be another copy.

Once hfile is copied to staging dir, there wouldn't be another copy.

Then what is the use of new API added in Store class ?


Path bulkLoadHFile(String srcPathStr, long sequenceId, boolean copyFile) throws IOException;
This is to cover the case where secure bulk load endpoint (manager) is not used.

I think you are targeting this only in master branch and I think after HBASE-13701, secure bulk load endpoint (manager) is part of our core code.
Please correct me If I am wrong ?
I also target branch-1 where secure bulk load endpoint is not mandatory.

Can we add a new method in LimitedPrivate interface in a minor version ?
Also you are always passing copyFile as false


@Override

  public Path bulkLoadHFile(String srcPathStr, long seqNum) throws IOException {

    return bulkLoadHFile(srcPathStr, seqNum, false);

  }

So it will not copy the hfile.

Patch v7 passes copyFile parameter to store#bulkLoadHFile()

Can we add a new method in LimitedPrivate interface in a minor version

I think we can.

Ted Yu, can we implement master branch patch considering only secure bulk load endpoint (manager) case and branch-1 patch handling both the cases ?
Thanks.

In your next patch, please correct the log message also.


+    if (copyFile || !FSHDFSUtils.isSameHdfs(conf, srcFs, desFs)) {

       LOG.info("Bulk-load file " + srcPath + " is on different filesystem than " +

           "the destination store. Copying file over to destination filesystem.");

There could be a problem with rolling upgrade compatibility. If some region servers are not upgraded, we will see some files get renamed and some files get copied.
Ping Enis Soztutar.

The above description is not accurate.

The normal bulk load would not pass copyFile parameter. The files would always be moved.

Backup / restore should not be called during rolling upgrade.
Even if the user performs restore, the fail move would fail, leading to failed restore.

-1 overall

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
This issue adds a config, always.copy.files, to LoadIncrementalHFiles.
When set to true, source hfiles would be copied. Meaning source hfiles would be kept after bulk load is done.
Default value is false.
